item.title: 05 Notes
item.description:
INTRODUCTION

  1. K. V. Subrahmanya Aiyer, “Pattattalmangalam Grant of Nandivarman,” EI 18 (1925–1926): 115–124; Minakshi 1977: 85–86.

  2. Rea 1909: Plate LXIV; EITA 1.1 Text: 68–74.

CHAPTER 1

  1. Unless otherwise noted, all translations are my own.

  2. Another tritala-vimana, whose sitting icon shares the bottom floor with icons of the goddesses Shri and Bhumi, was built in Nemali north of Kuram, perhaps during the reign of Nandivarman’s great-great grandson, Aparajitavarma (ca. 875–889). During Chola rule, one was built in the Chola realm at Dadapuram (1006), and two in the Pandya realm, at Mannarkoyil (1024) and at Chermadevi (1035).

item.title: 06 Glossary
item.description:
T= Tamil; all other terms are Sanskrit

abhayamudra (abhayamudrā) “fear-not” mudra of protection; the open hand faces the viewer with thumb and fingers straight up

abhichara (abhicāra) employment of spells for malevolent purposes

abhigamana cleansing rites performed before sunrise

abhijinmuhurta (abhijinmuhūrta) auspicious midday hour

Abhimanyu Arjuna’s son

abhisheka (abhiṣeka) unction or ceremonial ablution

abhun-nripa (abhun-nṛpa) unborn protector of men

abja born of water

abrahmanye (ahrāhmaṇye) in violation of the duties of a Brahman
